title: Muktoshukti (Pearl & Mother-of-Pearl Powder)
excerpt: Traditional mineral tonic (pearl / mother-of-pearl) used as a classical Rasayana in Ayurveda — for professional use and under guidance.
content:
## What Is Muktoshukti?
Muktoshukti is a classical Ayurvedic mineral preparation made from purified and processed pearls or mother-of-pearl. Historically used in Rasayana (rejuvenation) therapies for skin, reproductive health, and systemic nourishment.

## Ayurvedic Significance
Used in specific therapeutic contexts after careful purification (shodhana), muktoshukti is believed to provide cooling, nourishing, and strengthening benefits when administered appropriately.

### Key Benefits (Classical Uses)
- Traditional support for skin radiance and complexion.
- Used in some classical formulations aimed at reproductive and vitality support.
- Considered a potent Rasayana when prepared and dosed correctly.

## Ingredients & Processing
- Purified pearl or mother-of-pearl powder processed per classical shodhana methods (detoxification and purification).

## Usage Instructions
- **Use only under the guidance of a qualified Ayurvedic practitioner.** Dosage, form (powder, bhasma, or ghrita-based), and duration are practitioner-determined.

## Packaging
- Small amber jar with strict dosing instructions and practitioner advisory label.

## Safety & Consultation
- This is a mineral product that requires professional oversight. Avoid use without practitioner supervision. Pregnant women, children, and those with chronic conditions should consult a qualified practitioner.

## Why Choose This Product?
Sourced and processed by traditional methods with clear practitioner-use labeling—intended for clinical or practitioner-guided Rasayana regimes rather than casual supplementation.
